text: Ludwig van Beethoven's Piano Sonata No. 6 in F major, Op. 10, No. 2, is a piano sonata composed for Countess Anne Margarete von Browne. It was written between 1796 and 1798. It was first published in Vienna by Joseph Eder in 1798. The sonata is about 14 minutes long. ==Form== The sonata has three movements: ==References== Piano Sonata 006 Category:Compositions in F major
title: Piano Sonata No. 6 (Beethoven)
